intro: Aspidium cunninghamii, commonly known as the common cliff fern, is a species of fern native to Australia. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas. Its spores are released from the sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Aspidium cunninghamii is well adapted to arid conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
